channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024121162
item.description:
Report X-2024121162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared, no-spill. Damaged carton containing twelve 5-oz aerosol cans of Big D Odor Control Fogger. Outer carton is crushed, damaged by water. Label on one can damaged, but no leakage of a hazmat occurred. Limited quantity diamond covered by shipping label.

item.title: Report X-2024121181
item.description:
Report X-2024121181

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Undeclared Hazmat (no DOT labels, markings). Leaking box of 50 sunscreen aerosols (sizes 5.5oz-8oz) and 29 sunscreen lotions/tanning oil (6-8oz). 4oz aerosol Cutter insect repellent also included. 35.8oz lost from at least 12 aerosols, due to improper preparation for transport.

item.title: Report E-2024120255
item.description:
Report E-2024120255

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately 35-gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent, absorbents, and hand tools to clear all product from the site. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120929
item.description:
Report X-2024120929

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two glass bottles with Styrofoam packing peanuts. One of the glass bottle broke spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024121187
item.description:
Report X-2024121187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/06/2024 at approximately 2230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a hazardous material spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing two smaller boxes, each with 12 aerosol cans inside. Two one cans in one inner package accidentally discharged, resulting in spillage. The cause of the discharge is unknown. The discharged canisters were discarded, and the remainder of the shipment was placed in a salvage drum, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
